availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Israel C. Winfrey (Russell County, Kentucky, merchant and Union soldier (later a resident of Adair County))

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda E. Winfrey. Father of Margaret C. Winfrey, Frances E. Winfrey, Millard F. Winfrey, and William J. Winfrey. Merchant in Russell County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Russell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from January 30, 1862 to July 5, 1862. Appointed as a commissioner of The Columbia and Burkesville Turnpike Road Company by an act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 703.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District of Russell, p. 210B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0262.
Mike Watson, “The Winfrey House & an Epidemic of Cholera, 1873 in Columbia, KY,” ColumbiaMagazine.com, http://columbiamagazine.com/index.php?sid=57546 (February 10, 2013).
Mike Watson, “Mike Watson: Early Roads and Bridges of Adair County, KY,” ColumbiaMagazine.com, http://columbiamagazine.com/index.php?sid=64595 (January 14, 2014).
Ely McClellan, An Account of the Epidemic of Cholera, During the Summer of 1873, In Eighteen Counties of the State of Kentucky (Cambridge, MA: Riverside Press, 1874), 29-30.
Find A Grave, "Israel Clinton Winfrey (1828-1873)," Memorial #6128267, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6128267 (accessed June 1, 2020).
